pr_title: [insteon] support Dimmer/Switch Beep and LED On/Off as well as Motion Sensor Dawn/Dusk and Low Bat

timeline.message:
Added Beep and LED On/Off to dimmers switches (and keypad dimmers and switches).  Also added Dawn/Dusk and LowBattery to motion detectors.

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

Added Beep and LED On/Off as channels

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

Added Beep and LED On/Off channels to README.md

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

Added Motion Sensor Dawn/Dusk and Low Batt as channels and to README.md

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

Added Motion Sensor Dawn/Dusk and Low Batt as channels and to README.md

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: so the last three bytes of the message are 0?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Yes, per @robnielsen 's comments below, I've changed code to set these specifically to 0x00
replies.author: tommycw1

timeline.bodyText: Is this variable used anymore then?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: No, this was leftover from previous usage and I've now removed it from new code
replies.author: tommycw1

timeline.bodyText: Can we use something more generic than "dawndusk"? This assumes that the variable is associated with the sun rise/set.
timeline.author: robnielsen

replies.bodyText: I can make it whatever you'd like, but I think this is the traditional way to refer to this feature on motion sensors going back to old X10 stuff. How about lightdark?
replies.author: tommycw1

replies.bodyText:
change to:
public static final String LIGHTDARK = "lightdark";
replies.author: tommycw1

timeline.author: robnielsen

timeline.bodyText: I assume this was accidental? Eclipse formatting produces the original formatting.
timeline.author: robnielsen

replies.bodyText: do you mean with multiple on each line?  I had a really hard time reading this so I changed to one per line similar to formatting in InsteonDeviceHandler.java.  I can set to however you want.
replies.author: tommycw1

replies.bodyText: This is not following how it is formatted when using the code formatters built into eclipse
replies.author: robnielsen

timeline.bodyText:
Remove commented code.
Convert to hexadecimal, and explicitly assign values to the 3 bytes (even if they are 0x00).
timeline.author: robnielsen

timeline.bodyText:
Remove commented code.
Convert to hexadecimal, and explicitly assign values to the 3 bytes (even if they are 0x00).
timeline.author: robnielsen

timeline.message:
Changed a few variable names to better match standard and removed commented out code.

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

Chnged variable for light sensor above threshold to betther match standard and fixed formatting to better match standard

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

Changed WirelessMotionSensorLightlevelabovethreshold to WirelessMotionSensorLightLevelAboveThreshold per request

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

Changed WirelessMotionSensorLowbattery to WirelessMotionSensorLowBattery per request

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>
